Footage demonstrating how a Russian MiG-31K launches the Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missile.

Yesterday evening, several Ukrainian FP-1/2 drones struck the Donetsk Metallurgical plant in Donetsk City, impacting multiple different parts of it.
This plant has previously been hit by HIMARS GMLRS.

Yesterday evening, several Ukrainian FP-1/2 drones struck the Donetsk Metallurgical plant in Donetsk City, impacting multiple different parts of it.
This plant has previously been hit by HIMARS GMLRS.

Earlier, 1 Zircon hypersonic cruise missile launched from Cape Chauda, Crimea, impacted a target near Sumy City.   This is the third recorded usage of a Zircon so far, and the second this year (last was on August 21). Both missiles this year targeted Sumy.
A large fire is burning in Sumy after a Zircon missile impacted the city.
A large fire is burning in Sumy after a Zircon missile impacted the city.
A large fire is burning in Chuhuiv, Kharkiv Oblast, after the city was targeted by several Geran-2 drones.
A large fire is burning in Chuhuiv, Kharkiv Oblast, after the city was targeted by several Geran-2 drones.

Overnight, Cherkasy Oblast came under attack from Russian Geran-2 drones. Impacts were recorded in/near Cherkasy City, Uman (possibly at the airbase), and Zvenyhorodka. 
The exact targets are currently unknown, but some of the drones in Cherkasy City hit on the outskirts.

Overnight, Cherkasy Oblast came under attack from Russian Geran-2 drones. Impacts were recorded in/near Cherkasy City, Uman (possibly at the airbase), and Zvenyhorodka. 
The exact targets are currently unknown, but some of the drones in Cherkasy City hit on the outskirts.
Scenes from the Geran-2 drone attack on the Bila Tserkva combined heat and power plant in Kyiv Oblast. This plant was also struck by around 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles.
Scenes from the Geran-2 drone attack on the Bila Tserkva combined heat and power plant in Kyiv Oblast. This plant was also struck by around 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles.

Russia has launched a new series of attacks across the international border with Sumy Oblast, aimed at reaching the village of Myropillya. 
Chechen "Akhmat" special forces, along with a motorised rifle battalion of the 15th Tank Division are taking part in assault operations from the village of Kucherov to the large forest just across the border. So far, no advances have been confirmed. Ukrainian drones are very active in this area.
This evening, 4 Russian Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles launched from 4 MiG-31Ks impacted Starokostyantyniv Airbase, Khmelnytskyi Oblast.

Russian forces have achieved a localized breakthrough in Novopavlivka, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, and have quickly captured most/all of this town. 
A relatively strong Ukrainian defensive line has now been completely compromised.

Russian forces have captured the village of Orestopil, Pokrovsk'e direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~574.
Total land area: ~1.68 km¬≤.

Russian forces have re-established control over the village of Sosnivka, Pokrovsk'e direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~206.
Total land area: ~1.00 km¬≤

In the Richky direction, over the past few days Russian forces have resumed attempts at regaining full control over the Glushkovsky District of Kursk Oblast. 
Russian forces began a series of attacks towards the heavily entrenched Ukrainian positions in and around the Novyi Put Tract. They attacked south down two parallel treelines, entering the tract from the northwest. Other forces improved their positions along the railway line and consolidated in the rest of a perpendicular treeline. Heavy fighting is ongoing, with Ukrainian forces using a significant number of drones to repel the attacks. 
+ ~0.19 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Khotin and Yunakivka directions, Russian forces intensified their assault operations aimed at recapturing previously lost positions in Sumy Oblast.
In the west, Ukrainian forces once again attempted to infiltrate the western part of Oleksiivka via the agricultural buildings. Russian forces then launched a series of counterattacks and cleared these buildings, before beginning a push down the road to Andriivka. At the same time, Ukrainian forces continued attempts at entering and entrenching in the eastern part of Oleksiivka.
To the east, multiple Russian assault groups used an underground pipeline to attack Ukrainian positions to the rear of Varachyne. Ukrainian formations stationed in the area were aware of this pipe and immediately fired on Russian soldiers emerging from it. Nevertheless, the numbers of Russian soldiers who emerged were too high for the Ukrainians to contain, forcing them to withdraw from the area. The surviving Russian soldiers established control over some treeline positions, and Ukrainian drones are trying to pick them off. Two attempts at reconnecting with other forces to the northwest failed with casualties. 
Meanwhile, due to the complicated situation for Ukraine and the disruption of their supply routes, Russia was able to enter the northern part of Varachyne relatively unopposed and consolidate in the houses there. Attempts are now underway to establish control over the rest of the village. Other forces advanced west of Varachyne, capturing new treeline positions on the tactical heights. 
In the east, following earlier unsucessful attacks and consolidation attempts, Russian forces resumed assault operations in the village of Yunakivka and recaptured positions in the southern part of the village. They are now consolidating and attempting to accumulate additional infantry in order to establish control over the last parts of the village.
+ ~3.97 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Unprecedented Clashes Signals Near Escalation In Syria‚Äôs Al-Suwayda
Clashes broke out between government forces and Druze fighters across the front in the southern Syrian governorate of al-Suwayda over the night of November 13 and 14, in a sign of growing tensions between the two sides.
The crisis in al-Suwady began in July when an attack by government forces and allied bedouin fighters claimed the lives of over 3,000 people, third of whom were Druze civilians. Israel intervened at the time to protect the Druze, citing its historic ties with its own Druze community.
The battle ended with a ceasefire brokered by the United States, but over 30 Druze towns in the northern and western countryside of al-Suwayda are still held by government forces.
The forces are also believed to be holding hundreds of Druze civilians hostage, allegedly up to 600, and continue to impose a partial blockade on the governorate.
üëâ

Explosive Night: Russia and Ukraine Exchange Massive Strikes
On the night of November 13-14, Russia and Ukraine exchanged a series of large-scale strikes, accompanied by active operations of air defense systems. According to a statement from the Russian Ministry of Defense, Russian air defense forces destroyed 
216 
Ukrainian unmanned aerial vehicles. The largest number of drones were intercepted over Krasnodar Krai (66), Saratov Region (45), and the airspace above the Black Sea (59).
According to the Ukrainian Air Force, Russian forces used 
449
 means of air attack against Ukrainian territory, of which 419 were successfully destroyed. Specifically, 14 out of 19 missiles and 405 out of 430 drones were shot down.
The capital suffered the most severe damage. In Kyiv and the Kyiv region, air defense systems, command posts, and facilities of the Ministry of Defense were hit, along with warehouses, repair bases, transport hubs, UAV bases, and an aircraft repair plant. 
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Captures Rog, Clears More Parts Of Pokrovsk And Myrnohrad
On November 14, the Russian military captured Rog to the east of the city of Pokrovsk and expanded its control in Myrnohrad nearby in Donetsk.
The capture of Rog, also known as Rih, by the Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces was announced by the Russian Ministry of Defense, which later said in its weekly briefing that the 2nd Army carried out more attacks against Ukrainian troops trapped in the western part of Pokrovsk, in the northwestern and eastern quarters of the Central District, as well as in the city‚Äôs western industrial area.
In addition, the ministry said that seven attacks by Ukraine‚Äôs 32nd Mechanized Brigade, the 425th Skala Assault Regiment, and the 1st Assault Regiment were repelled by Russian troops near Grishino.
üëâ

Russian Army Captures Orestopol, Expands Breakthrough In Dnepropetrovsk
On November 14, the Russian military captured another settlement in Dnepropetrovsk and expanded its breakthrough towards the Haichur River.
The Russian Ministry of Defense said that the 9th Combined Arms Army‚Äôs 36th Guards Motorized Rifle Brigade, a part of the Vostok [East] Group of Forces, captured Orestopol after advancing more than four kilometers in Dnepropetrovsk.
‚ÄúDespite heavy fire and counter-attack attempts, assault groups moved forward in fits and starts holding the pace of combat actions and preventing the enemy from gaining a foothold. Servicemen from Transbaikal acted in a clear and cohesive manner: soldiers quickly took up strongholds, cut off defensive posts, and opened the way for other units,‚Äù the ministry said in a statement.
‚ÄúA vast area of defense of more than 12 square kilometres was brought under control, and more than 250 buildings were mopped up,‚Äù it added.
üëâ

Iran Seized Oil Tanker In Strait Of Hormuz As U.S. Navy Watched
The United States on November 14 accused Iran of seizing a crude oil tanker as it traveled through the narrow Strait of Hormuz.
The seizure was first noted by the British maritime security firm Ambrey, which said that a Marshall Islands-flagged Talara tanker, en route from the United Arab Emirates to Singapore, made a sudden course deviation while transiting the Gulf of Oman and headed towards Iranian territorial waters. Shortly afterward, Ambrey described what happened with the Talara as an assault involving at least three small boats.
The incident was also reported by the British military‚Äôs United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center, which said that a possible ‚Äústate activity‚Äù forced the Talara to turn into Iranian territorial waters.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Without Preparation, Without a Mission": Testimony of a Captured Ukrainian GUR Serviceman on the Landing Near Pokrovsk
A serviceman of the Ukrainian GUR special forces, Ruslan Shakhun, born in 1995, was captured by Russian forces. He was a member of the "Black Winter" unit, part of the "Timur Special Unit," and was captured during a helicopter landing on the outskirts of Pokrovsk on October 31. The operation was carried out on the orders of GUR head Kyrylo Budanov under conditions where Russian forces had established control over a significant part of the city.
According to Shakhun's testimony, the preparation was conducted in a short timeframe and raised many questions for him. The fighter described the preparation process, noting the presence of senior leadership and three training landings. However, he expressed doubts about their effectiveness: "You are ready. Ready for what? Who the hell knows. Without preparation. Without any means. Without a specific task." 
üëâ
